fieldScalingDesc1: Pick the deployment strategy that best suits your app. Choose a fixed size for the number of replicas your app will be deployed on, or specify a minimum and maximum number of replicas for your deployments. This will dynamically optimise performance, and adapt to the number of requests via the auto-scaling option.
replicasInputLabel: Number of replicas your app will be deployed on
haInfoHelper: Deploy on a minimum of 2 replicas for high availability
resourceTypeInfo: The metric that will act as the trigger for auto-scaling
scalingBillingInfo: Please note that the number of replica nodes you choose will increase the number of resources you use.
errorFormMinMaxRepField: Minimum Replicas must be less than Maximum Replicas
metricUrlInfo: Full URL of the API operation to call to obtain the metric value
dataFormatInfo: The type of file you are calling
dataLocationInfo: Location of the metric value in the response payload. The value depends on the location.
targetMetricValueInfo: Target value for scaling. When the metric provided by the API is equal to or greater than this value, scaling occurs upwards. If the metric is less than or equal to 0, scaling is brought back to 0. (This value can be a decimal number.)
targetMetricValueMinimum: Target value of the metric must be greater than 0
targetMetricValueRequired: Target value of the metric is required
aggregationTypeInfo: Type of aggregation to perform before comparing the aggregated metric value to the target value. For example, if you choose AVERAGE, the value compared to the target value for scaling will be the average of the metric values from each replica of your AI Deploy app.
